alert.note: Alert for Knox (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 6:43PM CDT until August 29 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Illinois, including the following county, Adams. Portions of northeast Missouri, including the following counties, Knox and Lewis. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. While the rainfall totals so far are not excessive, there are indications the storms may become stationary the next few hours, resulting in additional heavy rain and minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Quincy, Canton, Quincy Regional Airport, Camp Point, Mendon, La Grange, La Belle, Lewistown, Ewing, Maywood, Steffenville, Plevna, Ursa, Coatsburg, Novelty, Columbus, Monticello, Newark, Fowler and Paloma.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
